places.name: Amber Fort
places.description: A hilltop fort in Amer, Rajasthan, known for its artistic Hindu-style elements.

places.name: Hawa Mahal
places.description: The Wind Palace, a five-story façade with 953 small windows designed for royal women.

places.name: City Palace
places.description: A royal residence with museums and courtyards, showcasing Rajasthani and Mughal architecture.

places.name: Taj Mahal
places.description: A white marble mausoleum built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

places.name: Agra Fort
places.description: A historical fort in Agra, situated on the right bank of the Yamuna River.

places.name: Mehtab Bagh
places.description: A garden complex situated opposite the Taj Mahal, perfect for sunset views.

places.name: Red Fort
places.description: A historic fort in Old Delhi, famous for its Mughal architecture.

places.name: India Gate
places.description: A war memorial located along the Rajpath, dedicated to soldiers who died in WWI.

places.name: Qutub Minar
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the tallest brick minaret in the world.

places.name: Gateway of India
places.description: An iconic arch monument built during the 20th century in Mumbai.

places.name: Marine Drive
places.description: A 3.6 km long boulevard in South Mumbai, famous for its evening views and sunsets.

places.name: Elephanta Caves
places.description: Rock-cut caves on Elephanta Island, featuring ancient sculptures of Hindu deities.

places.name: Victoria Memorial
places.description: A large marble building in Kolkata, dedicated to Queen Victoria.

places.name: Howrah Bridge
places.description: A cantilever bridge over the Hooghly River, one of Kolkata's iconic landmarks.

places.name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
places.description: A famous Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali, situated on the banks of the Hooghly River.

places.name: Lalbagh Botanical Garden
places.description: A famous botanical garden with rare species of plants and a glasshouse.

places.name: Bangalore Palace
places.description: A grand palace inspired by England's Windsor Castle, featuring Tudor-style architecture.

places.name: ISKCON Temple
places.description: A modern temple dedicated to Lord Krishna, known for its spiritual atmosphere and architecture.

places.name: Marina Beach
places.description: One of the longest urban beaches in the world, popular for morning walks and sunset views.

places.name: Fort St. George
places.description: A historic fort built in 1644, now housing the Tamil Nadu legislative assembly and a museum.

places.name: Kapaleeshwarar Temple
places.description: A famous Dravidian-style Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.

places.name: City Palace
places.description: A massive palace complex overlooking Lake Pichola, combining Rajasthani and Mughal architecture.

places.name: Lake Pichola
places.description: A beautiful artificial freshwater lake, famous for boat rides and views of palaces.

places.name: Jag Mandir
places.description: An island palace on Lake Pichola known for its architecture and serene environment.

places.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
places.description: A famous Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located on the western bank of the Ganges.

places.name: Dashashwamedh Ghat
places.description: A historic ghat along the Ganges, known for evening Ganga Aarti ceremonies.

places.name: Sarnath
places.description: A Buddhist pilgrimage site where Lord Buddha gave his first sermon.

places.name: Baga Beach
places.description: A popular beach in North Goa, known for water sports and nightlife.

places.name: Fort Aguada
places.description: A 17th-century Portuguese fort overlooking the Arabian Sea.

places.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site housing the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier.
